meanings.definition: Of or relating to the balance between the Coriolis force and the pressure gradient force in the atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The geostrophic winds blew steadily across the sky.
meanings.sent2: Meteorologists study geostrophic conditions to predict weather patterns.
meanings.sent3: The geostrophic clouds seemed to dance gracefully in the air.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a geostrophic whirlwind of conflicting thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The geostrophic nature of the airflow was mesmerizing to watch.
